intro: Solanum lentum, commonly known as the common nightshade, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are followed by berries that ripen to a bright red or yellow color. Solanum lentum belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and contains toxic compounds such as solanine, making it potentially harmful if ingested. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
